summary: This document is a chain of emails from September 2020 between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and attorneys for the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein. The SDNY is seeking a deposition transcript from a 2009 civil lawsuit involving Epstein, and the estate's attorneys are coordinating its release after confirming no protective order exists. The emails also discuss scheduling a task force call to review the transcripts.

persons.name: Marc A. Weinstein
persons.role: Partner and Chair of White Collar Defense at Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP, representing the Epstein Estate
persons.context: He is the primary correspondent for the Epstein Estate, coordinating with the SDNY to provide a 2009 deposition transcript and ensuring legal compliance regarding confidentiality.

persons.name: Andrew Tomback
persons.context: He is consistently copied on the email chain between Marc Weinstein and the SDNY prosecutor, indicating involvement in the legal matter.

persons.name: Jack Scarola
persons.role: Plaintiff's attorney in the 2009 civil lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: He represented the plaintiff in the lawsuit and is contacted to confirm the absence of a protective order governing the deposition transcript sought by the SDNY.

persons.name: Mark Luttier
persons.role: Attorney who represented Jeffrey Epstein in the 2009 civil lawsuit
persons.context: He is identified, along with Bob Critton, as having represented Jeffrey Epstein during the plaintiff's deposition in 2009.

persons.name: Bob Critton
persons.role: Attorney who represented Jeffrey Epstein in the 2009 civil lawsuit
persons.context: He is identified, along with Mark Luttier, as having represented Jeffrey Epstein during the plaintiff's deposition in 2009. He was part of Critton, Luttier, and Coleman LLP.

connections.description: Both are attorneys working together, as Tomback is consistently copied on Weinstein's correspondence with the SDNY regarding the deposition transcript.

events.title: Plaintiff's Deposition in Civil Lawsuit
events.description: A deposition was taken of the plaintiff in a civil lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein. The plaintiff was represented by Jack Scarola, and Epstein was represented by Mark Luttier and Bob Critton.

events.title: SDNY Task Force Call Scheduled
events.description: The NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force schedules a call for Friday afternoon to discuss the obtained deposition transcripts.

events.title: Connection with Plaintiff's Attorney
events.description: Marc Weinstein is asked to connect directly with plaintiff's attorney Jack Scarola to discuss the deposition transcript and any confidentiality issues.

events.title: Confirmation of No Protective Order
events.description: The SDNY informs Marc Weinstein that plaintiff's counsel is unaware of any protective order relating to the lawsuit, clearing a path for the transcript's release.

keyFacts: The SDNY investigation in September 2020 was actively seeking a deposition transcript from a 2009 civil lawsuit involving Jeffrey Epstein.
The deposition was of the plaintiff, who was represented by attorney Jack Scarola, while Epstein was represented by Mark Luttier and Bob Critton.
Attorneys for the Epstein Estate, led by Marc Weinstein, confirmed with the plaintiff's counsel that no protective order governed the transcript, allowing its release to prosecutors.
The NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force planned to review the transcripts on a scheduled call, indicating their relevance to the ongoing investigation.
The email chain demonstrates coordination between law enforcement and the Epstein Estate's legal team to obtain historical evidence for the SDNY's investigation.
